name: Doorways: Old Prototype
description: An immersive and twisted adventure created before the official development of the Doorways saga
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP, Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8 Processor: Dual core CPU @ 2GHz (Pentium D or better) Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA 6800, ATI 1950 Storage: 150 MB available space Sound Card: 100% DirectX 9.0c compatible Audio Device Additional Notes: Keyboard and mouse or Gamepad

reviews.review_text: Actually this prototype works and plays way better than 3rd part of their game :) I didn't played the previous parts, so it's hard to compare.  Anyway, if you are bored, unsure what to do and you want game for about 40 minutes - it's PERFECT for you.
A pretty decent way to share how the game was created and developed over the years, great job!
Is a prototype, nothing more. But its free and it's nice to see the tough process of the developers.
Loved the Doorways games yet to play Holy Mountains of Flesh. This was a nice refresher.
realy nice game who likes minecraft will like it realy nice to play when you boring and i feel to free bhop here like in cs go :D 7/10

Really cool. At first I was puzzled for the lack of menu after the game starts. I mean, what if I needed to pause or exit? Nevertheless, this game has a big atmosphere. A kinda of suspense. A feeling of 'what do I do now?' is something I love in a game.

its a great 1hour to 30 min game, It can be very eerie with the ways you play I suggest not playing this game at night. overall this is a (prototype) of a full lenght game. It is also very intriguing might give this series a look at. controls were simple make sure you always look at the controls in a game @players, for it may be confusing to some.  9/10.
Waste of time. Only for fans, terribly made, inconsistent controls, and worst of all, boring as all hell.
The gameplay is fine but if the goal of the game is to scare you it doesnt come close. when it comes to games im a ♥♥♥♥♥. I get scared easy and this i didnt feel anything.
